dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 3127 IH: Supporting all Healthy Options when Purchasing Produce Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Crockett (for herself, Mr. Alford, Mr. Thompson of Mississippi, Mr. Bacon, Mrs. Miller of Illinois, and Mr. Casar) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008 to provide families year-round access to nutrition incentives, including hard-to-serve areas, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Supporting all Healthy Options when Purchasing Produce Act or the SHOPP Act.

subsection.text: Section 4405 of the Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 7517) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating clauses (ix) and (x) as clauses (x) and (xi); and
by inserting after clause (viii) the following:

clause.text: increase year-round availability of incentives by offering fresh frozen fruits or vegetables;

paragraph.text: in subsection (c), by striking fresh fruits and vegetables and inserting fresh or fresh frozen fruits, vegetables, and legumes each place it appears.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall take effect on March 6, 2024.
